payload.content: Traditional browser automation for AI agents is slow, taking 10-45 seconds per action, and unreliable, failing 15-30% of the time, while consuming significant resources (500MB+ RAM for a headless browser).

name: Traditional browser automation for AI agents is slow, taking 10-45 seconds per a
content: Traditional browser automation for AI agents is slow, taking 10-45 seconds per action, and unreliable, failing 15-30% of the time, while consuming significant resources (500MB+ RAM for a headless browser).

payload.content: Many web actions performed by browser automation are essentially API calls disguised as button interactions.

name: Many web actions performed by browser automation are essentially API calls disgu
content: Many web actions performed by browser automation are essentially API calls disguised as button interactions.

payload.content: A website's internal API call can return data in 200ms, whereas browser automation for the same task can take 12 seconds.

name: A website's internal API call can return data in 200ms, whereas browser automati
content: A website's internal API call can return data in 200ms, whereas browser automation for the same task can take 12 seconds.

payload.content: A workflow involving 10 web actions can take over 2 minutes with browser automation, compared to 2 seconds with direct API calls.

name: A workflow involving 10 web actions can take over 2 minutes with browser automat
content: A workflow involving 10 web actions can take over 2 minutes with browser automation, compared to 2 seconds with direct API calls.

payload.content: The browser acts as a Graphical User Interface (GUI) on top of underlying API calls, which agents do not necessarily need.

name: The browser acts as a Graphical User Interface (GUI) on top of underlying API ca
content: The browser acts as a Graphical User Interface (GUI) on top of underlying API calls, which agents do not necessarily need.

payload.content: Unbrowse operates by observing website network traffic via Chrome DevTools Protocol during a single browse session, capturing all XHR, fetch, WebSocket, auth headers, and cookies.

name: Unbrowse operates by observing website network traffic via Chrome DevTools Proto
content: Unbrowse operates by observing website network traffic via Chrome DevTools Protocol during a single browse session, capturing all XHR, fetch, WebSocket, auth headers, and cookies.

payload.content: Unbrowse analyzes captured network traffic to identify real API endpoints, automatically detect authentication methods (Bearer tokens, cookies, API keys), infer parameters, and cluster endpoints by resource.

name: Unbrowse analyzes captured network traffic to identify real API endpoints, autom
content: Unbrowse analyzes captured network traffic to identify real API endpoints, automatically detect authentication methods (Bearer tokens, cookies, API keys), infer parameters, and cluster endpoints by resource.

payload.content: Unbrowse generates a complete API skill, including documented endpoints, a TypeScript client, and authentication configuration, enabling agents to directly call these APIs without needing a browser for subsequent interactions.

name: Unbrowse generates a complete API skill, including documented endpoints, a TypeS
content: Unbrowse generates a complete API skill, including documented endpoints, a TypeScript client, and authentication configuration, enabling agents to directly call these APIs without needing a browser for subsequent interactions.

payload.content: Unbrowse is a plugin for OpenClaw, an open-source framework designed to enable AI agents to perform actions like sending emails, managing calendars, deploying code, and monitoring chats autonomously.

name: Unbrowse is a plugin for OpenClaw, an open-source framework designed to enable A
content: Unbrowse is a plugin for OpenClaw, an open-source framework designed to enable AI agents to perform actions like sending emails, managing calendars, deploying code, and monitoring chats autonomously.

payload.content: Unbrowse enhances OpenClaw agents by making their web interactions 100 times faster.

name: Unbrowse enhances OpenClaw agents by making their web interactions 100 times fas
content: Unbrowse enhances OpenClaw agents by making their web interactions 100 times faster.

payload.content: An agent's first visit to a website uses a browser, but subsequent visits leverage direct API calls, allowing the agent to become faster with more use.

name: An agent's first visit to a website uses a browser, but subsequent visits levera
content: An agent's first visit to a website uses a browser, but subsequent visits leverage direct API calls, allowing the agent to become faster with more use.

payload.content: Every API captured by Unbrowse becomes a 'skill' – a reusable package that any OpenClaw agent can install, enabling an ecosystem where agents can share and trade these capabilities.

name: Every API captured by Unbrowse becomes a 'skill' – a reusable package that any O
content: Every API captured by Unbrowse becomes a 'skill' – a reusable package that any OpenClaw agent can install, enabling an ecosystem where agents can share and trade these capabilities.

payload.content: A marketplace will be built where agents can share and trade skills using x402 micropayments, allowing agents to acquire capabilities autonomously without human approval.

name: A marketplace will be built where agents can share and trade skills using x402 m
content: A marketplace will be built where agents can share and trade skills using x402 micropayments, allowing agents to acquire capabilities autonomously without human approval.

payload.content: The current methods for AI agent web access are problematic: official APIs are rare (~1% of websites), MCP servers require manual building, and browser automation is slow, brittle, and expensive.

name: The current methods for AI agent web access are problematic: official APIs are r
content: The current methods for AI agent web access are problematic: official APIs are rare (~1% of websites), MCP servers require manual building, and browser automation is slow, brittle, and expensive.

payload.content: 99% of the web is currently only accessible to agents through slow browser automation, which Unbrowse aims to unlock at API speed.

name: 99% of the web is currently only accessible to agents through slow browser autom
content: 99% of the web is currently only accessible to agents through slow browser automation, which Unbrowse aims to unlock at API speed.

payload.content: Every website inherently possesses internal APIs, as modern web applications like React apps and SPAs fetch data from backends, with the browser merely serving as a rendering layer.

name: Every website inherently possesses internal APIs, as modern web applications lik
content: Every website inherently possesses internal APIs, as modern web applications like React apps and SPAs fetch data from backends, with the browser merely serving as a rendering layer.

payload.content: Browser automation involves a redundant four-step process: launching a browser, rendering HTML from JSON, scraping HTML back into data, and clicking buttons that send API requests, when a single direct API call could suffice.

name: Browser automation involves a redundant four-step process: launching a browser,
content: Browser automation involves a redundant four-step process: launching a browser, rendering HTML from JSON, scraping HTML back into data, and clicking buttons that send API requests, when a single direct API call could suffice.

payload.content: $FDRY (2ZiSPGncrkwWa6GBZB4EDtsfq7HEWwkwsPFzEXieXjNL) will be used as currency to incentivize contributions to the agentic web.

name: $FDRY (2ZiSPGncrkwWa6GBZB4EDtsfq7HEWwkwsPFzEXieXjNL) will be used as currency to
content: $FDRY (2ZiSPGncrkwWa6GBZB4EDtsfq7HEWwkwsPFzEXieXjNL) will be used as currency to incentivize contributions to the agentic web.

payload.content: OpenClaw and Unbrowse are open-source projects, installable via `npm install -g openclaw` and `openclaw plugins install @getfoundry/unbrowse-openclaw` respectively.

name: OpenClaw and Unbrowse are open-source projects, installable via `npm install -g
content: OpenClaw and Unbrowse are open-source projects, installable via `npm install -g openclaw` and `openclaw plugins install @getfoundry/unbrowse-openclaw` respectively.
